modules.description: Provides functions to parse, format, and manipulate time tuples, user identifiers, messages, notices, and actions. Works with structured data including time, user, msg, notice, action, and line types. Used to process and transform log entries or chat messages into standardized formats.

This module offers low-level lexical analysis and string parsing capabilities, handling operations like character classification, token extraction, and substring manipulation on strings and Unicode characters. It enables specific tasks such as extracting structured data from text inputs, including line positions, message content, and time-related components through targeted parsing functions.

Parses input streams into a list of tuples containing position data and abstract syntax tree nodes. It processes lexers, channels, and strings, extracting structured content with line, column, and offset information. Used to convert raw text input into a format suitable for further analysis or transformation.

Formats AST content, integers, and time data into a structured output stream. Processes line-based data including timestamps and associated content. Used to generate human-readable logs or debug outputs with precise formatting.

Parses ZNC log files into structured event data, extracting timestamps, nicknames, and messages. Processes raw log lines using pattern matching and string manipulation to generate typed records. Supports analysis of chat history by converting unstructured text into accessible, queryable formats.

Processes and transforms log entries and chat messages by parsing, formatting, and manipulating time tuples, user identifiers, messages, and actions. It handles structured data types such as time, user, msg, notice, action, and line, enabling tasks like extracting message content from raw text, converting input into ASTs with positional data, and generating formatted output. Lexical analysis functions support character classification, token extraction, and substring manipulation, while AST formatting capabilities produce structured logs with timestamps and content. Examples include parsing a log line into a standardized time-user-message tuple, extracting message content from a string, and generating a human-readable log from an AST.
